column5: I figured id post more nature pics rather than fish pics this time around.  enjoy.             the most birds ive ever seen. wish i had a wide angle lense, there was literally thousands of birds. when they took off it sounded like a prop plane taking of cause of their wings smackin the water. very cool annd rare sight indeed.   ofcourse the last chromer of oct,
Nice pics!  Do you jack up the contrast in your pics or does your camera shoot like that?  Looks really cool in the seagull pic at the bluffs.

i play around with some of them, its hard to take the time sometimes when im out to take a proper picture with the correct settings so i usualy do some touching up. a couple of the pics uptop might have been overdone actually.

Technically speaking Mark, your 14-42mm is a wide angle lens (albeit a zoom lens).  Definitely wishing I had the 10-20mm though for my own baby.  I could make my fish look twice as big in hero shots  Really digging the early morning/evening shots.  Iâ€™m hoping to shoot some star/sunrise time lapse vids in the future when I pick up a new digital timer
Very nice pics.  I like the bridge one the best!!  Joey
It's that overdone effect that I enjoy, actually  .  Do you edit with CameraRAW/Photoshop? I'm trying to learn them, myself.
I've been trying to get a shot like that for years. Beautiful.
VERY NICE !! Fall is a great season for photography.The lighting gives every thing that contrasted look.Thanks for sharing these. Paul
thanks on the input guys! "I've been trying to get a shot like that for years. Beautiful." that too is my fav atm and is currently my wallpaper.

Uh so you do own an Olympus too!  I posted on Kelfun's fb pic (a pic of you) and asked whether you had an olympus (cuz i saw the neckstrap), but he probably thought i asked him and said he owns the Olympus tough.  Great shots!
haha thanks, its actualy my dads and i just bring it out with me.
Us Canon and Nikon owners point and laugh in the faces of Olympus DSLR owners  HAHAHAHAHA!!!!!!!!!!!
I love Olympus cameras, and I have used their 24 megapixel jobs for over 30 years... an OM-1 with Fujichrome!
Mike, next time you land a fish I'll help you dunk it in the river and test out how "weather resistent" your camera is

lol one time we were leaving rouge and i put the camera on top of my friends ek hatchback and somehow forgot it there until it was a little too late. got out and low behold nothing more than a few scratches, not even the lense cap came off lol.
You just might be better at nature watching than steelheading! Nice stuff bro. I think you could take some real nice scenery shots out my way.
